Comments_List: I learned about the history of different writing hands, about the processes of manuscript production, and cultivated my paleography skills reading different scripts nearly each week.

The biggest strength of this course is that we got to work with and examine authentic examples each week from Yale's collection of what we were studying. I also found a very interesting make-up of students in the class. I think a weakness of this course was how the assignments reflected only a small part of what we were studying and also the expectations that were given for them were at times not entirely clear.
I would! When else will you have the chance to study properties of manuscripts alongside the actual objects?! So cool!
